text: Popped in for lunch, and had a few tapas from the regular menu.  Both were really good but the empanada was excellent with an amazing sauce!  Not a cheap lunch per se but worth the extra coins.
Just ok. Tough competition with some other greats in town like babareeba. Big plates, wide variety, but just not as good as it used to be (2017 compared to 2013)

Live down the street and a passed many times thinking I should try it. Finally stopped in after they change their sign which gave it a updated look. It's going to be my new favorite go to place. Large Tapas plates. Everything was fresh. Craft cocktails. Ceviche type dish was flavorful and not your standard Lemon doused with hot peppers. The white bean soup was absolutely phenomenal and we did not even try any of the entrées. Five tapas was too much for the two of us and we both went home with leftovers.  The goat cheese tapas was touted as a house favorite. My daughter concurred. We sat in the bar. The dining room is noisy but looked fun and busy. Looks like a place locals frequent.

This is the one restaurant that I have frequented the most over the years. Up till now I have always given them a 5 star rating. Why the change? Well I went there during the winter, and asked to sit on the side with the deli, as I have in the past I was told that the other side was currently being renovated. I thought to my self, renovation great. Now wait hold on!! The other side was  perfect, it didn't need any improvements. That side reminds me of the many places I have eaten at in Madrid, Espana. Better yet the food was almost on par with the places in Madrid. Over the years, I have taken many friends and family members there to enjoy the food and ambiance. We celebrated many special moments there. Just prior to leaving after every meal, I scoped out all of the Spanish products being offered for sale at the deli. Normally, I would always find something, in addition to taking home some serrano ham, manchego cheese, and chorizo butifarra. This was my routine for many years. This is one of the only places where I could pick up chorizo to put into my signature dish at home, paella.   Well, I purposely didn't go for months to allow them time to finish the renovation work that they started. Upon my return, I did my usual, as soon as I stepped in and faced the hostess; I requested to sit on the side with the deli. To my surprise the hostess said, that side has been blocked off and is no longer part of the restaurant. There was some sort of disagreement between the building owner and the restaurant owner; and as a result the lease was not renewed. I was probably standing with my mouth open in astonishment!! At first, I was speechless, I never wanted to sit anywhere else. We ended up being seated upstairs in what was once called the pintxos restaurant. I have to admit that I did not enjoy the ambiance up there. Nor the fact, that there is no more deli! The sudden realization that everything changed set in, and saddened me. Will I continue to frequent this restaurant? To be honest; I don't know?

Finally made it to Cafe Iberico! My sister has been recommending this spot forever and now I see why! The service was awesome and the food was amazing! Came here with a friend and we ordered the paella de pollo, cazuela de carne asada, gambas al ajillo and patatas bravas!  Oh and can't leave out the pitcher of sangria  Everything was so delicious. If we had to rank them we'd say gambas al ajillo #1, paella de pollo #2 and patatas bravas and cazuela de carne asada on an even playing field. Will definitely come back the next time I'm in Chicago!

Minus 1 star because the hostesses were really rude. Like super disappointing they are the first people you see at the restaurant. Anyways the food was really good. Especially the paella! Get the chicken with the rice and caramelized onions, also really good. And the lamb! For dessert, the bananas, caramel and ice cream is pretty bomb. It's almost like a banana foster! And our server was really nice, but I forgot his name.

The tapas they serve are different than any tapas in New York City. They are great and I would love to try every single item on their menu( too bad I have a small stomach). The service is great and the food comes out quick and tasty.

For being a tapas restaurant, their food is just okay. The quality of their bread was very disappointing. It was definitely a pre-sliced, bagged, loaf from a local grocery store and did not taste authentic or homemade at all :(. The menu seemed to have great specials.

This is downright the best tapas place in all of Chicago. You can't go wrong with the patatas bravas and bacon wrapped dates. I'm not a huge fan of paella but this paella isn't bad, the quantity is large enough to fill the bellies of a large family and the quality is definitely good.

The food is really quite tasty! Great flavor, quick service and authentic flavors. Not badly priced either. However this place gets loud. No sound dampeners so every table echos across the restaurant. I could barely hear the person next to me. We had to yell across the table just to be heard, making the restaurant even louder. Good food but the ambiance and the noise leave something to be desired.

Café Iberico is a great place to grab authentic Spanish food. The restaurant itself is really dark, and the atmosphere is a little noisey, but the food itself is hard to beat. My girlfriend (who studied in Spain for a semester) and I ordered croquetas and a vegetable paella. Both were pretty tasty! While it's not EXACTLY what you may find in Spain, it's about as close as you can get to the real deal!

Repulsive. I believe the only people Giving this place 4 stars are the minute individuals of the city. The crowd was offensive. The food was microwaveable. And a vodka cost $19 - more than the cost of paella and more than one of the high end rooftops in river north...who sport a  high class, respectable crowd. If I could rewind time and take back 1 regret in life it would be coming here. It feels like an amusement park food court and I am repulsed that I was seen in this venue. Lasalle street at its finest unfortunately I have to choose 1 star because -10 is not an option.
Best food ever the service was great. I think it depends what you order. I come here and I'm an hour away. You have to try it .....

Patatas Bravas are amazing!  White Sangria is delicious!  Cazuela de Carne Asada was very tasty.  The Carne Asada was tender and juicy. Not dry like I've had it at other places. The service has always been great here. I'm understanding that I've been there during busy hours so I don't mind if they take a bit longer to check on the table but so far no issues. I recommend this place for people who are new to Spanish tapas.

I have been coming to this restaurant since 1998 or maybe even earlier and I have never had such a horrible experience. I am not sure if there are new owners? It doesn't even have authentic Spanish decorations on the wall. There are medieval shields up? They look completely different inside and much smaller. The place has very loud music which was never the case before. We will not be back. I am on a search for a new authentic Spanish tapas place.

Enjoyed dinner and drinks here last night. I had Salmon with potatoes and asparagus. It was a healthy and fulfilling dinner.  :) For drinks we tried the Sangria (red wine) with fresh fruit...excellent choice.

Noo thanks Not much about this restaurant that left a positive impression on me - food, service, ambiance, everything, subpar. First off it feels like a dungeon. When it fills up it feels a little claustrophobic. Servers come around every now and then to take plates and refill drinks/water, but not frequently enough. Also our server forgot to put in the "hot" tapas we ordered, so there was a bit of a gap in our meal vs a steady stream of plates coming out. The sangria is terrible, I didn't finish my glass. The food - I honestly can't remember anything I liked very much. We had smoked salmon, jamon with manchego, seafood salad, two types of paella (iberico and the special with cuttlefish and cauliflower), chorizo and murcilla, croquetas, ensalada de pollo, pulpo de plancha, and patatas bravas. I'll skip the stuff that was just ok (not great and wouldn't order again) and cover the bad - patatas bravas were unlike any I've ever had, they were boiled potatoes covered in a weird sauce (not fried with hot sauce and aioli like I'm used to). The paellas were bad, like in a blind taste test with microwave rice-a-roni I would fail. Bland rice, low quality ingredients, 0 saffron flavor, not even a little hint of socarrat?  Anyway, this isn't a place I'd return. In a city full of good food there's no reason to waste time here

I've been coming here for years because it's our favorite restaurant and the food is still delicious. But I am so disappointed in how much the atmosphere has changed. They've done a remodel and closed half the restaurant so the wait was 45 minutes due to the smaller space. AND I'm still deaf from the noise level! Seriously I couldn't hear my son sitting right next to me. I have a pretty high tolerance for noise and we are not quiet people either but even my kids said it was WAY too loud. Such a bummer.

This place used to be good, but no longer. We had lunch here on Saturday, as we were craving tapas. The food was not fresh nor were the ingredients high-quality. The peppers tasted like they came from a jar. The mushrooms had no flavor. Salads were mostly iceberg lettuce. The tortilla Espanola tasted like it had been premade, but not recently. We also tried the vegetable empanada, and I have no idea what was in it as it was unlike any empanada I had ever had before. It was not good. We will not be back.
Best Tapas! Food was delicious! Noise level was a bit too much but that's something you can't control. Otherwise it was an overall great experience! The Pulpo A La Plancha you must order!!!!!!

Been here many times and by far this was the worse service ever. Food and service have been declining over the years. A waiter never came to our table, prompting us to wave down the manager to get service. Had to ask for water repeatedly and to top it off, two dishes that we ordered was given to another table. Our waiter didn't even know and we had to tell him so we wouldn't be charged. Service was slow except for when we were served the bill. Will think twice before coming back again!

We came in on a Sunday night around 10pm, so it wasn't very busy. We were seated immediately on the bar side and had waters within a few seconds of sitting down. We ordered the pincho de pollo, the shrimp, and shank of lamb. Pincho de pollo and lamb shank were delicious. Wished I had more chicken it was so tasty. The shrimp was a little too oily for our taste but was still seasoned/flavored well. Loved the atmosphere and service was decent.

I came here for dinner and was excited to try this place. It was a disappointment... the jamon iberico was so thin that it felt like I was eating nothing! Definitely not the experience I remembered from my Spain days... overall the food was bland and dry. It left me very disatisfied! The only redeeming thing was the red sangria. I ordered a pitcher and I pretty much drank it all myself! Will go back for drinks but nothing else...

This was my first time trying cafe iberico . Normally I'm not really into tapas but these tapas were pretty good . You have to go with a big group to really enjoy the different options they offer , because you honestly want to try as much as you can since the portions are small ! The one thing I really liked was the sangria . The white sangria was my favorite . Lots of flavor from both the wine and the different fruits mixed in. The one thing I wasn't too happy about was our service . Our waitress wasn't all that great. She would only come over when she would see us wave her down . She never really check in on us or if we needed anything . I think I waited at least 20 minutes to get my watered refilled which I wasn't too happy about . I try not to say anything negative about waitresses and waiters since I was one before and I know how it can be on a busy day but to wait for water is just straight up annoying .  Other than that , I think I'll have to maybe go again to try some of the tapas I didn't try and hopefully the service will be better as well .

Came here for dinner on a Sunday night with a few friends. If you're craving tapas, make the trek up to Ba Ba Reeba for something better. Atmosphere: One positive- it was a lively environment, a solid amount of people for a Sunday. The place was somewhat bustling. Service: To start, our table wasn't even cleaned up properly. There were still dirty napkins left on it. Our server forgot one of our orders and we ended up leaving it because it took so long. Our server also forgot to bring our bread-- which every table but ours was receiving when they first arrived. We asked for it, along with eating utensils. Food: We ordered the parrilla mixta (squid, shrimp, octopus special of the day), the paella, gambas and patatas bravas. The parrilla tasted burnt. The gambas were decent, the patatas never arrived. The paella was also decent. All in all pretty mediocre. I visit Cafe Ba Ba Reeba frequently and wanted to try something new... but in this case I'd stick to what I know is good. I will not be returning to this café.

I enjoyed Café Iberico. Per the recommendation of one of my favorite salespeople I decided to give it a try because it honestly wasn't on my radar. Two other things also contributed to my visit, I didn't want an extremely strong cocktail nor did I want a hefty meal. Today was extremely hot so a pitcher of cold sangria sounded real appetizing. The restaurant put ice cubes in your cup only & not the picture as to not dilute the sangria.  It was tasty, not to strong not to light. I felt sort of like a lush seeing as how I dined alone & had an entire half picture of sangria on my table but the guilt disappeared after my 2nd cup. The shrimp dish (Gambas al Ajillo) was kind of boring. There's flavor there but the dish lacked creativity in my humble opinion. It's honestly something I could've made at home. Now the Croquetas de Pollo was a different story altogether. Once the waiter explained that it was creamy I decided to indulge. Imagine if you will a better & lighter version of "Chicken Cordon Bleu". The aioli that came with was extremely thick however & if spread heavily could totally overpower the "puffs". This dish was great though. Prices are fair & aside from the annoying music in the bar area the ambiance was nice as well.

The most authentic Spanish restaurant I have been to this side of Atlantic - great seafood, both cold and hot tapas. You have to try gamba al ajillo, pulpo a la plancha...desserts are awesome too - flan, ice cream filled crepe with strawberries, etc.

This hidden GEM in downtown Chicago was  DELICIOUS!! It was referred to me by a bartender at a hotel I was having a drink at. The tapas were outstanding and you get to choose between small or large orders. I had the pork and the scallops large plates.....YUM YUM YUM. When I go back I will be trying 5-10 small tapas so I have the Best of All Worlds. Dinner for two with a glass wine $46 in downtown Chicago GiddyUP!!! Tasty Value is MY FAVORITE!!!! DO it Do it Do it!   #HAPPYTUMMY :)
Enjoying dinner with my sister and Dad. This is just a taste of Spain. We're definitely going to visit the Spanish motherland. Food is delicious. The variety of tapas....omg... scrumptious.

Love the variety of different plates, i like how you can share the tapas with the rest of the people sitting on your table. Sangria is good, the red one is better than white. Music is a little too loud. Service is always great.

This was my very first time visiting the Cafe, and I was very impressed. The service was excellent, fast and friendly. Excellent customer service. The food was very good. I'd recommend this restaurant to everyone. Delicious!

I've frequented this place many times.  Unfortunately, today is the last time. Treated extremely rudely by the hostess. Racism?  Not  sure, but when asking to  be seated in another area of the restaurant that was more accommodating for me  and  my guy she quickly became visibly agitated and slammed our menus on the table. Wow! We just wanted a table  where we could sit side by side. Restaurant wasn't even crowded. The manager was no help when we complAined.  Perhaps a trend here.  Not going back....

Really like this place! I've been here a bunch when I lived here a few years ago and visited again last night for dinner and it did not disappoint! There was a short wait, but my friend and I got drinks at the upstairs bar while waiting. 1/2 pitcher of sangria is $14 and is about 4 glasses or so of sangria, which I think is a great deal. The sangria was awesome too. Once seated, our waiter kept coming by and filling up our glasses and gave us some good advice on what to order. We ordered the tortilla espanola (standard, but still super tasty), potatas bravas (way way too spicy for me, but if you like that I would recommend them), veggie empanada (delicious and a huge portion), and Pulpo a la Gallega, which was for sure the standout dish. The octopus was super fresh and tender and even tasted good as leftovers the next day! I have also gotten the garlic shrimp from here and remember that being great. Great food and good value. Will return!

Great food, except the cold bread serves before food arrived. Service was ok, to their defense they were slammed and had a couple of big parties and we also arrived two hours before closing time. Will give it a second try.

I love tapas to death and when I want to treat myself I come here! Their paella is worth every penny it is in point and I love trying new tapas every time I go. Their red wine selection is off the hook and they are generous with the pours. I usually only get one glass because they fill that up all the way to the top! I love it here and it is usually packed with people like families, couples, all kinds which I like because it doesn't cater to a specific crowd. If you love good Spanish food this is the place to go.

It's been two years since I have eaten here because I live out of state. I was beyond thrilled to find this restaurant. I love Spanish cuisine but little is available in Los Angeles. Paella is a favorite and they did not disappoint. The decor is lively and suits the business of the restaurant. There might be a wait, do plan accordingly. I wish this restaurant was near me because I'd be here weekly.

We had ordered several dishes. Good food but place needs a good overall cleaning. Plus I was not too happy when food was brought to the table the plates were stacked on one another. Indent in the rice. On all of them. Also my bread and butter plate was dirty.  Come on people time to retrain your staff.  Overall the food was good. Red sangria is a must.  No rush to go back.

I have been here 50 times. This is the worst service ever. The 3 ladies in the front were very rude. Called for reservations and still had to wait over an hour. Not during a busy time. When I called for Reservations they assured me that I would be seated right away with no wait. They have seated over 40 people since we have been waiting for our party of 15. Hostess were very rude and probably should not work here anymore. Terrible customer service. Skip this place.

While reasonably priced, found food and sangria disappointing.  I always get garlic shrimp in a Spanish restaurant, and I thought this dish was "meh." The shrimp just weren't very good.  Nor did I care for the mussels-- I like them smaller.  The fig/cheese and spicy potatoes were best of our order.  Acceptable and moderate if you happen to be in the neighborhood.  As others have noted: noisy.

I feel deeply hurt, disgusted, insulted and upset to see how a restaurant offers spanish (from Spain) traditional iconic dishes....and has NOTHING similar to it. Please stop bombing spanish gastronomy and making it into something bizarre like what I've seen. As a spaniard, I please beg to "chefs" or "cooks" some knowledge of what they are cooking and offering/selling to people out there. THIS IS NOT EVEN CLOSE to a paella, pulpo a la gallega or bravas...

Environment 1/5: super noisy and dark.  Seafood paella 3/5: rice are too hard and the shrimp are not very fresh.  Spicy potato 3/5: spicy sauce is all of the top. Bottom ones taste very good.  Dates 3/5: the rice is too hard.  Seafood 4/5: fair.  Service 2/5: we tried to find the server but other staff just walk by and say it is none of their business.  Overall a very disappointing experience
One of friend recommended this place for their food and ambience. Food cooked to perfection and they have great selection from the menu. Don't miss the desserts.
Food was okay. If I go back I will try paella.  We were placed at a table near the hostess station and bathrooms so not a great spot. I've had better tapas elsewhere
This place has great hot and cold tapas. It's worth the prices. Plus the sangria is refreshing and great. The only thing that's a little challenging is the parking since its in the city.
Came here last year and it was great. Was back in town for work again and vouched for this place with my coworkers. What a huge let down, made me look bad. Quality is out the window now.

I'm obsessed. Everything is delicious and the place is reasonably priced. It has a really fun vibe ideal for groups of frands.  Order the goat cheese, grilled octopus, croquettes, and the mussels! I would eat the caramel onions for 3 meals a day if I could. Everything else is delicious too.

I used to love this place, but now it seems kinda meh...I think they lost their charm. The food is average, but I guess for the price point it's OK. Octopus and scallops are still good, mussels, on the other hand, I would not order again. I hope they make some changes.

Okay seriously! I am a total fan of this place, it's both super fun and down to earth. I've been here on many occasions. On Fridays when it's packed with hungry, loud people and music videos on all the televisions and on Tuesdays where it's super chill and quite. I have to say I loved both! I like the menu they offer but enjoy the mini menu the most. This mini menu consist of paper list that has tapas in tiny portions , which actually is so nice for people that want to try everything, since it comes in much smaller portions than the actual menu. I enjoy this place not only for the food but for the service as well. Been to Cafe Iberico a million times and every time, I leave completely satisfied.  The price is super reasonable & the location is perfect! Oh, and Queso de Cabra is a must try! I works extremely well with large groups and the sangria is to die for!

Place is incredibly mediocre. The sangria doesnt taste good, the patatas bravas were missing the aioli sauce that makes them good, the tortilla espanola was bland, and the paella wasn't good either. Cafe babareeba is a much better option and not that much more expensive

Best Spanish food i've had since living in Madrid. The prices are not crazy like most Spanish restaurants and the food is authentic and tasty. Also the atmosphere is fun.   I only wish this place was in Phoenix also.

I have eaten here countless times over the past 10 years and the tapas never disappoint. The scallops, the canelon de atun, the queso de cabra. I've never had a small dish here that disappointed. (I had a very salty paella a few years ago, and I've avoided it since. Why get it anyway when the tapas are so damn good?!) The problem is the noise. I was just there last weekend and it's gotten worse. And the remodel is a darn shame -- will they reopen the north-side room? or is it gone forever, now belonging to a different establishment? I hope they bring it back.  Also, a side note: It's very annoying that they won't take reservations of parties smaller than six.

The service is good. The decorations are nice. It is our first time to try Spanish food, it worth the try! We got fried calamari and grilled octopus for appetizer, grilled chicken skewers and seafood baella as an entrees. Also we got caramelized banana and crepes stuffed with ice cream for dessert. Me and my husband liked the place but not the kids they barely ate. I give them 4 stars because the taste is not my style but worth the try!
Had a corporate dinner here. It was  supposed to be to mend ties with our other team. We'll, we didn't improve relationship with you that team, but the food was great!

We came here for my boyfriend's birthday two weeks ago. I called to make reservations and they said they couldn't do that for weekends and that was fine but when we got there, we had to wait a really long time. Which we didn't mind at all actually because there was a bar in the front and you know how that goes.  When we finally got seated after almost 45 minutes of waiting, we were seated in this really crammed area basically eating right next to the strangers next to us left to right and behind each of us.  Our table was a bit crammed for the dishes we ordered, we ordered the seafood paella with two different tapas dishes and had both our wine glasses.  The lighting was nice given the type of atmosphere it was; dim and with little lighting. But our server was the saving grace of this place.  He was kind and came whenever we needed things and asked if we needed more and offered us the menu again. Finally, the food was good.  We ordered scallops and shrimp tapas, it was seasoned really nicely and we had unlimited bread with olive oil. Overall, it wasn't a bad experience, but I think coming on a weekday might have made the experience much better for us.

Awesome place. Good menu and the food is great. Cheap sangria and also good! I like the music, it's open late, you can get wine to go and we always have awesome service. The pulpo a la plancha is probably the best dish we've gotten there. The shrimp was the only one I thought was not great. You can't beat the price for the paella.

This tapas place is ok but not great.  Been here and there are several things that could get improved to be a quality overall restaurant.  Food tends to be a bit bland - sometimes food sounds better on the menu but disappoints when it reaches you...hit or miss. Last time I was there, I had to ask for my coke several times and I received my salad with no drink to wash it down.  I was done by the time the guy remembered but at that point I just told him to forget since he STILL didn't have it with him. We were super crowded and were put in a corner...couldn't move at all. Overall, I think a restaurant like this lives because somehow they have a great reputation.  However, if you've had tapas before, you may find this place to not meet your standards.

This place is the best tapas joint I have ever been too. I have never had grilled octopus and was skeptical to order. However, my first impression of grilled octopus is one I will never forget. The grilled octopus at cafe iberico was so flavorful and cooked to perfection. The waiters are super fast at providing consumers with all of their needs, as well as being extremely friendly and respectful.  Definitely the spot!

Came in on a Tuesday night around 6 and sat down right away which was good. Ordered Grilled Shrimp, Calamari, grilled mushrooms, patasbravas, stuffed dates, and artichoke. Overall pretty good. The shrimp, mushrooms and the dates were especially good. The services was just ok....Didn't bring us water refill until we asked. I would rather try a different restaurant, but wouldn't mind coming here again.

This review is based solely on the drinks and atmosphere of this place. Our server always made sure we were okay and came by frequently. The party I was with order appetizers, but I didn't join as I had previously eaten. It did smell and look amazing though! The bar/drinks were standard and not too much to rant or complain about. The atmosphere is really laid back but loud, if that makes sense. Nice warm decor and low lighting helps this place become a spot you'd want to join coworkers for happy hour or a date night.

I've been coming here for years. I loved this place but the last few times I've been back it was just not the same. The entrance had a weird sewer smell, food seemed to not taste the same, I think they deep fry there octopus instead of grilling it now and they still have Christmas bows up(makes me feel that they don't care about how the place looks or the ambiance they are creating for the customers. The servers are very nice and attentive, I just hope they make some changes because it was one of my favorite places.

Every time we come here,  the service just gets better.  Food is great as always.  Paella should be eaten first though and then the other dishes because the paella has lighter refreshing taste than the heavier richer taste of other dishes.  All in all though,  everything was delicious! The potato salad is a must try!

Food wasn't great.  Very bland.  We were seated upstairs where its just bare walls and food network on 2 big screens.  Incredibly overpriced for what you get.  We just did a bunch of tapas, none of which were memorable.  The queso was good, but its hard to make bad queso.  The grilled octopus was slimey and served with soggy french fries.  The olives and mushrooms were ok but overpriced.  Croquetes were gross.

My boyfriend and I had lunch at Cafe Iberico yesterday, 2/16/2017. The service was great, the food and sangria were yummy but after we paid our bill and we're finishing our drinks, a very large rat ran into the dining room from a hole next to the server station. A server was standing there so he put his foot out and it ran back into the wall. I literally sat there speechless because I couldn't believe what I saw. Afterwards, the server and a person who I assume to be the manager as well as another server stood be the area checking it out and talking. I've never experienced anything so disgusting in my life and told the woman I assumed to be the manager so when we left and she just kept saying sorry over and over. I later pulled up their health inspections and they've had several fails over the years some noting rodent drippings and roaches.

Overall more miss than hit in the hit or miss. If you're comparing to cafe ba-ba-reeba.....really no comparison. Their bacon wrapped dates are 6/10. Their empanadas are a 3/10, if I had to give a comparison I'd say a calzone with salty undercooked dough. It was pretty awful. Chicken was dried out. Overwhelming flavor of dough. Not good. Some of their more expensive ($26) specialty items have been solid but a lot of their staples including their paella  are mediocre at best. We had the Cazuela De Cordero tonight....tasted like an extremely dry pot roast. Literally competing with beef jersey in tenderness. Overall underwhelming. If I had to sum it up I'd say Cafe Iberico is the Denny's of tapas. I keep coming back periodically to be unimpressed mostly because it's a walk vs a taxi from river north. They need to step up their game.

Not at all like I remember.  We used to come here often in the 90's and early 2000's.  The tapas were great back then.  Sadly, it's not the same as it used to be.  We gave it a few tries in hopes it was just a fluke, but it just isn't worth our time and money anymore.  I never cared for the sangria, it always tasted watered down to me and it's always been a very loud and busy place with long waits.  Service was always hit or miss due to the sheer volume of customers, but when you top it with food that isn't that good, we are done with this place and I do not recommend.  If you just want an atmosphere where you and your group can hang to drink and eat where the taste of the food doesn't matter, this is your place.

The food is great, but the reservations are terrible. We stopped in with a small party of 3 and they said 30 minutes to seat us.over an hour later and they did not have a table ready. We ate at the bar but was not pleasant.  Recommend staying away.

An unassuming place, but don't let the simple looks fool you. Very scrumptious tapas (that's Spanish for "you need to order everything") that are small on quantity, but large on flavor. A great low key way to fill up. The seafood is worth it, particularly the calamari

This is one of our favorite places to go to. I sangria is always consistent and compare to other restaurants very reasonable. We always have the octopus with fries which is always tender and tasty. The ambience is always fun and the service never disappoints.

Well I celebrate my daughter bday today Food was bland Service was very good I try sangria was good Papatas bravas Queso de cabra  Dates w/bacon Paella iberico  Croquetas de pollo And dessert crema catalana and crepe w/ice cream

Just the classic tapas place in Chicago!  Best blend of authenticity, consistency, atmosphere!  The owner is often there which says allot about why Iberico is such a great place to dine and relax!   Also the place becomes quite reasonable if dining with 4 or more!   Ordering the rice Spanish dish also makes the meal go farther.

My wife and I visited here for a family brunch. Amazing food. You won't be disappointed. If you're a picky eater or you have a larger than life appetite. I recommended the grilled octopus or the spicy potatoes. We ate family style, so the plates kept coming. I ate quite a lot of food I  never thought I could. It was awesome. The service was fantastic. The waiters/waitresses were attentive and appreciative of all the customers. Great restaurant, I would recommend it!!

It is fine. This place does not make me too excited but it's ok to go have sangrias and share and enjoy small dishes. Some dishes are excellent, some not so much. Mostly heavy on my stomach. I would go again.

I ended up here after plans at another restaurant fell through.  Luckily Cafe Iberico was close by and we were able to get a table relatively quickly.  The restaurant is loud and active.  After sitting down we ordered a pitcher of sangria and started looking through Cafe Iberico's expansive menu.  The menu was impressive, with tons of options and pretty much everything sounding great.  The ensalada mixta was good and larger than I expected.  As a big fan of empanadas, I was very underwhelmed.  Patatas Bravas which is my girlfriend's favorite spanish tapa dish was again just okay. We ended the meal with the paella iberica and found this to be poorly seasoned, and nothing special.  Overall the service was average, and the food was unremarkable.  The sangria, however, was quite good.  Unless you are coming for the drinks and atmosphere, there are better tapas places in the city.

I have been to this place a few times and used to love it. Probably the closest Spanish food that you are going to get in Chicago. Recently, I was not as much impressed with their service. Their paellas ould have been a lot more flavorful. Love their shrimp with garlic  and olive oil, lamb shank dish.  Good place to catch up with friends rather than a date.

I've been here multiple of times for many years now. And tonight was the worst experience that I've had at this establishment. Once my husband and I arrived we were told the wait was about 30 minutes. We ended up waiting much longer. Once seated we immediately ordered our food and the food took about 30 minutes to get to us it wasn't even hot not a single soda refill not breadAfter asking to speak to the manager she came to us and seemed very indifferent towards the situation. I'm very disappointed due to the fact that this was my favorite tapas place but it's time to look for another one
Amazing service  Amazing food!! The environment is pretty good. Really good for a group of friends and family dinners

A couple of cousins and I went to Ibérico on a Saturday night to celebrate a birthday. The food was good, especially the champiñones a la plancha, the queso de cabra, and the vegetable empanadas. Unfortunately, our server, Janeen, delivered poor service. She barely checked in on us. We didn't even get bread and olive oil until we asked for it 20 minutes in. One of us ordered a coke and got it 30 minutes later. She then messed up the amounts to charge each card at the end. She didn't seem to care when we pointed it out. Bottom line is we got terrible service, which is too bad considering the solid reputation Ibérico has.

I am emailing to express my disappointment with the very poor service that my friends and I received at Cafe Iberico on December 19th.  Up until recently, I've enjoyed going to Cafe Iberico for the food and the service. I always recommend this restaurant to friends and family that are looking for a good tapas place in Chicago. Unfortunately, after our visit on Monday (December 19th), this has changed.  On the said date, my friends and I decided to go to Cafe Iberico to celebrate my best friend's birthday. The service started off in a very dissapointed way. It all began when I called to make a reservation that day. The person on the phone was rude, had an attitude and lacked any form of civilized communications. I overlooked her poor communication skills because I know Cafe Iberico is generally a good place with good food and good people.  In the evening, one of my friends was the first to arrive and was received by Lupe, who was very rude and unpleasant to my friend. She quickly stated to my friend that she was the first one from the party of six, but didn't state that she needed to wait til everyone arrived and/or offered up any waiting options --- something a host typically does to keep the guest busy.  We eventually got sat at a table nearest to the back by a closed door. As soon as we sat down we realized that it freezing cold, probably due to the door. Our waiter was not welcoming or accommodating and didn't even introduce himself. We had to ask one of the busser who came by with water, because at this point our waiter had left, to see if they could do anything about the cold and he didn't really say anything. We asked the same busser if we could move to the table behind us that was empty and one of the waiters came back to tell us that that table was reserved for a party that was going to be arriving soon. The best they could do was covered the seams of the door with a plastic bag and assumed that was going to help. It didn't. We were shivering the entire time.  One of my friend's glass broke and we had to ask twice to get someone to clean up the mess. Instead of property cleaning the mess, the waiter brought three napkins and thought that would suffice. In addition, we had to ask them twice to clean the water that had spilled on the floor, when it should've been done automatically.  The waiter rarely came, didn't ask to see how we were doing and didn't offer any refill on water. We order food that never got added to our order so it never came out. We ordered a second pitcher of sangria and only got it after we reminded the waiter. Two hours later, we paid. The food was great, but it was overlooked because of the poor service. At this point we were very annoyed and wanted to get the dinner over with. We noticed that the table behind us stayed empty. The party that was suppose to "show up" never did. This is what brought us over the edge.  As we made our way to the exit, my friend asked the same waiter who told us the table behind us was going to be occupied, where the party that was going to sit there was. The waiter avoided the question and sarcastically ask "do you want to speak to the manager?", and two of your employees, one being Lupe, the rude host laughed.  Needless to say, my friend's birthday dinner was a complete disaster because of your rude, unwelcoming and unapologetic staff. It was an awful experience at a restaurant that I use to love to go to. I hope you take this poor performance of your staff into consideration and improve your overall customer experience.
this has become one of those spots where you go after some late night partying on lasalle.  huge menu and space and great sangria, but sometimes the dishes are inconsistent.

Cafe Iberico is the perfect place for a great meal, lively conversation, and awesome people watching. Although it has gone through many changes over the past 20+ years, the food still remains as delicious as the first time I laid eyes on the plates.  This is the king of Tapas joints in Chicago, and the Sangria cannot be beat.  Keep in mind, the dining room is loud, and lively, and the room is fast paced. This is not the place to have an intimate dinner. although, If you want to sample many dishes, bring a large group. The portions are huge, and the prices are super affordable for being in River North.
I think it's OK. Paella was so so. Bacon wrapped dates and eggplant wrapped goat cheese were the best apps we had.  The sangria tasted watered down which was disappointing.

Cousins took me here while on vacation. Started with a pitcher or red wine sangria which was better than I expected since I'm not usually a fan. Ordered a ton of different plates. My favorite by far was the spicy potatoes, followed closely by the grilled octopus and fried calamari. Would definitely come back the next time I am in town. A little loud but great service.
Great value for the money. Octopus dish was pretty good but artichoke salad was a bit disappointing. Will come back.

This used to be our favorite place for get-togethers with college friends. We used to grab a few tables at the bar, pull them together, and share a table full of tapas with pitchers of sangria. Who could resist enjoying Spanish music in a beautiful bar with the walls decorated in authentic blue tile and the ceiling covered in wine bottles? It felt like home in more than one way, and the food was exceptional. Needless to say, I was looking forward to taking my fiancee there so that I could share an awesome experience like that again.  The place has changed a lot and has sadly lost some of its charm. We were seated downstairs in a dark room without any signs that this was an authentic Spanish restaurant. Instead of beautiful Spanish tile and pleasant music background, the walls looked bare, uninviting, and there was a big flat screen on the wall broadcasting some sort of cooking show (who wants to see that?). We were seated in the far corner of the room even if the place was empty at the time. There was a bar downstairs, but the bartender spent the entire evening chatting with staff who would come downstairs for a gossip or two. Our waitress must have had tables upstairs, because she checked in on us just once before we were done with our dinner. I was going for a romantic dinner with a Spanish twist, and ended up getting an almost food court-like experience. I'd give the atmosphere 1 star out of 5.  Food was hit or miss this time. Cazuela de Carne Asada was excellent, Pulpo a la Plancha was not bad, but Datiles con Jamon were way too sweet and not enjoyable at all. Sangria was ok, but it lacked the complexity of flavor that the old recipe used to have.  Overall, I wish I would have not come this time. Then I could remember the place how it used to be and not how it is now.

Excellent.  The food the wine the staff are excellent.  The only criticism will be tight tables, somewhat uncomfortable  for me.   But if don't mind crowds and cramp tables this is your place.  And it goes without mention this intimate scenario will yield to a load environment.  That said I would go back in a heartbeat.

My husband and I were extremely underwhelmed by this place, especially with having high expectations from seeing so many reviews and an average of 4 stars. We shared the octopus and potato tapa and also the chicken and seafood paella, and had a glass of one of the recommended red wines. Everything was very lackluster, including the wine. The paella could've been much more flavorful with more seafood. A small positive note is that the octopus was very tender and came on a large plate rather than what we expected as a tapa. Again though, this could've been much more flavorful. Although a good thing is we came early around 6:30 pm on a Friday night so we were able to walk right in. When we left an hour or so later, there was a huge wait. And overall, the restaurant was very noisy and much more of a place where people are bringing their kids and large families, rather than an intimate setting for a date. Unless you're at the bar area, which was a bit more dimmer and much more quieter.
It has been my favorite since I moved to Chicago. Looks that they recently increased the pricing, which was a bit sad, but I would still like here.

My favorite tapas restaurant in Chicago! Love the croquettes, chicken with rice (sauce that comes with it is the bomb!), fiola desert. Always fast and good service as well as great food and not the highest price tag! Try their sangria and the potatoes are also good!

We went with a group of people some who never ate real Spanish food. After a pitcher of sangria, several tapas of chicken, shrimp, squid and octopus we order a few more delicious main courses and finished off with a caramel flan. Order the lamb chop special even when not in the menu! Great restaurant if you do not need a fancy environment and come for the food

Came in recently on a Sunday night. We put our names down, and there were a bunch of people waiting by the hostess' table. They told us 25 minutes so we said sure, no problem. We ordered drinks at the bar and waited about 15 minutes until we were called. They brought us to the main room, which is around the corner from the bar - and there were a ton of open tables! It seemed like a pretty disorganized waiting process, and we probably shouldn't have been waiting at all. Even though there were plenty of 4-tops available in the middle of the dining room, the hostess attempted to seat us in a 2-top in the back corner, next to an exit door. Don't you hate that? We asked to move and were placed in a better table. The food was fine, and the service was good. We ordered the combination plate, the octopus, and the Iberian paella. The octopus was pretty soft, and not so flavorful. The combination plate was a good mix of prepared meats and cheeses. The paella was alright. The food wasn't particularly memorable, but it got the job done. I'd say the décor in here feels like Greek Islands meets Spanish cuisine.

Such a disappointment...came here with a very large group of people, which could have been part of the problem. Service was a little slow. Not enough protein, lots of potatoes. Normally I would provide more detail with such a poor review, but I have no idea the exact dishes we had, but we had about 10....one or two were really good, but the majority were just ok. I will come back as I think we may just have had too many people and didn't get to order what we wanted.

This is a great place for a group or family.  It was very crowded during weekend dinner and the noise level can be high at times.  The variety of Spanish food is excellent as well as the taste.   I would highly recommend the scallops and octopus dishes. The server was knowledgeable and friendly and the food came out reasonably fast although the restaurant was full.  The cost is very reasonable as well.

A place to go with people portions seem like they are meant to be shared!  My fork however had old dried food on it, they were very apologetic and the waiter was fine, just seemed like he wasn't expecting a good tip. Delicious and expensive.   Wish the style was more in sync with the taste of the food. Menus seem dated but over all a good foodie experience.

So far, this is one of my favorite tapas restaurant.we were seated right away but by the women's bathroom. We ordered the grilled octopus with fritas. It was my boyfriends first time trying octopus and he really liked it. Im glad because I didn't want him to have a bad experience the first time. We also ordered the tilapia. I wasnt a big fan. It was good but, maybe I wasn't in the mood for fish. Finally we had seafood paella. The very kind waitress said it would be 45 minutes but we didn't wait too long because she went ahead and put that order in first which was super awesome. The waitress was amazingly quick and patient and very nice. The only other thing besides the seats which i didnt like we're the two grown men sitting next to us being loud and obnoxiously banging on the table...otherwise everything was great. Love the food and also the price was reasonable. Thumbs up.

Came here with my boss who is French but married to Spaniard! We tried 4 different tapas! I am very much impressed and couldn't have asked for more! They are all delicious to the very last bit! I ordered the potato omelet that looks like a frittata cake, and shrimp with olive oil and red pepper flakes!  They are all delicious that makes you want more but you're just too full! Small portion but a full filling food!  Definitely a must go place when you're in town!

Another visit, even though tapas bars and small plate fare have become part of the American restaurant scene. Thanks to the Spaniards for encouraging us to stop ordering meals big enough for two and gorging ourselves. In Chicago there are numerous tapas choices and some more trendy than Iberico (Café Ba Ba Re Ba), although Iberico is now remodeling its major dining area. Competition is healthy. We find it fascinating that many European restaurants (Greek, sometimes German, Spanish, etc.) justify their traditional male-only wait staff. With a soup, a small-plate entrée and a dessert, we always find enough choices here to make us want to return. Next time we'll vary the fare by adding some tapitas, the smaller dishes for around $3 designed to accent your larger choices.

I came here based upon a friend's recommendation. I was both underwhelmed by the food and service. This place is obliviously vet popular and maybe the experience is meant to be experienced with a group and in the dining section.  I had the most inattentive bartender who didn't even try to engaging. I had to flag him every time I needed something and had to follow up on my order.  My meal was meh and my order was based upon Yelp reviews and the waiters recommendation.  Queso de Cabra (pesto bread with goat cheese and marinara) - cold and just bread with pesto and cheese. I could have made this at home.  Pastas Bravas (spicy potatoes) - these were tasty but I've had better. Champinoes a la Plancha (grilled mushrooms) - assorted mushroom medley. Just ok. There was a lot of different mushrooms but the flavors were not outstanding. Red Sangria - simple and straight forward but has too much ice and got watered down quickly.  Overall the portions were bigger than I expected. I would try this place again but in a group as the tables looked like they were all enjoying themselves.

I love this restaurant. Amazing food literally everything I've eaten: calamari, goat cheese salad, spicy potatoes, Paela, chops. The sangria red wine can't find any better. Portion sizes large and very decent price. We went there group of 6 tried 6 different dishes paid about 20 each. If sangria crowd, get a pitcher instead of individual cups; price wise makes more sense.
Chicken was tender and delicious.  Paella took long to cook, but faster than 45 min.  Grilled octopus recommend. Sometime spicy potato taste changed. Scallops are recommend too.

This place was nice but I really don't understand the hype. I came in on a weekday for lunch with my friend. The restaurant was huge with plenty of tables and seats around the bar area but only a few people were there at the time. Which is why I didn't understand why they chose to put us at a table RIGHT next to another couple. We were so close that our seats were touching and could hear every part of their conversation. It wasn't a huge deal but just odd that they chose to use their space like that.  Other than that, the service was fine. The food was decent as well. The best thing we had was garlic shrimp where the shrimp was cooked perfectly and tasted fresh. The next was the chicken and ham puffs. It's difficult not to like anything that is fried with melt-y flavorful filling.  I didn't really care for the seafood paella though. The rice was sort of dry and the seafood was just okay. Maybe it was because we were already so full by the time we got the paella but it didn't quite meet the expectations that all the reviewers raved about. I would recommend this place if you come with a large group so you can try different things and not get stuffed on just 2-3 dishes. It also seems like a fun place to have drinks with your friends. It's located in a nice area in the city. We were able to find street parking since it was the middle of the day but I can see that this place area would get quite busy at night especially the weekends.
This is the easiest, most convenient and delicious place to book a large party event.  I just spoke with Lupe in reservations who helped me book the reservation within 3 minutes.  Thank you so much!

Meh. Super average. The bread was stale, and the seafood salad was really underwhelming.  The chicken paella was just average as well.  I found the paella quite oily. Is it supposed to be so oily?  I don't think the quality of the ingredients is very high.  Would not return. We sat in the bar area, and the ambience was not great.  I can't speak for the main dining room.

This is my FAVORITE tapas bar in the city! I have been here countless times and each time it never disappoints. I love the food here. My absolute favorite is the grilled octopus. It comes with fries as well. Also the chicken with caramelized onions, as well as the beef with caramelized onions.I have actually had all of the tapas on the menu and there is not that I don't like. Every time I have gone I also have to get the Sangria. I have had both the red and the white sangria and both are great. I have been here for dates, with friends, with family, etc. Whatever the occasion you can come here!

Café Iberico had been on my list of restaurants to check out for almost 7 years, so I'm glad I finally made it here two weeks ago! I liked the ambiance and colors of the place as soon as I walked in. The restaurant was very loud and it was hard to hold a conversation across the table.  The food was great; I have absolutely no complaints about the taste of the three different dishes we ordered. The Paella Marinera (seafood paella), Patatas Bravas (spicy potato dish), and Pollo a la Brasa (roasted chicken with mashed potatoes and veggies) didn't disappoint. The highlight for me was the flavor of each dish. The Paella Marinera was enormous for three to share and was delicious. The amount of seafood in the dish was surprising as well (plenty to share with everyone). The Patatas Bravas were seasoned with the perfect amount of spice and tomato goodness, and I could literally eat them all day. The Pollo a la Brasa was cooked to perfection; the mashed potatoes that came with the chicken were the highlight of the night. Can someone either give me the recipes for the potato dishes and/or give me the phone number of the chef, pretty please? The red wine sangria was fruity and very refreshing. We ordered a pitcher and it was the perfect amount to share between the three of us. I wish I could give Café Iberico four and a half stars, because I only want to deduct .5 from the rating due to the service that night. Usually, if a restaurant is busy, I'm willing to let a few service issues go and give the place five stars. However, we were there on a Wednesday night and the place wasn't packed. There were a few empty tables in the restaurant. Our waiter did forget to bring the olive oil for the bread, even though we asked for it multiple times (it took over 30 minutes to finally get the oil upon asking a different waiter, hurray)! It took just as long to also get the check, pay for our meal, and leave. The attentiveness was lacking throughout the meal, but that was a minor issue. Overall, the food was solid, as was the sangria. And what really counts is the food, drink, and ambiance of the place. I'll be back to try some more tapas and paella here.

It is a three stars ánd a half. The food is good even though it was better before. The service is mediocre and really not much. We ate with a cleaning sign at the table. Water was spilled, glass cups broken and splashed. No apology either.

My friends did the ordering because I'm not picky. I just eat whatever is placed in front of me. The seafood paella, lamb with potatoes and mushrooms were delicious. A weird dish was octopus with french fries. I was like "What?" The octopus was perfectly cooked and tender.  We also liked the chorizo, goat cheese eggplant, chicken entree, clams, empanada, shrimp, etc. I can't remember everything sampled. The sangria was pretty good. However, the noise level was so loud that it bothered my sensitive hearing. Service was great. I still feel Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba is better.

Favorite. Tapas. Ever.  My wife and I compare all tapas restaurants to here and have yet to find a place that even comes close. Don't think we've ever ordered anything that we didn't like. The table spacing can get pretty cozy when they're filled up but doesn't take away from the experience IMHO. Never disappoints and always satisfies, sucks that I live in NYC now but will always stop by whenever I'm in Chicago!

Overrated. Ive been to Spain and this is far from authentic. The service is average and food quality is poor. The bread for the tapas was old. Try the grilled octopus and spinach salad with goat cheese those are the ones I actually enjoyed.

This place, for lack of a better word, blows.  Everything from Cafe Iberico tasted very similar in their use of peppers.  It was very difficult tasting contrasting flavors.  My girlfriend ordered an empanada that was very dull.  Its crust lacked the flakiness that you expect from legitimate savory pastries.  The paella iberico took 50 minutes to make and was extremely salty with the same aforementioned peppery flavor.  The only thing I enjoyed were the datiles con jamon.  My girlfriend is a vegetarian and she prefers Ba-Ba-Reeba.  That says something about how poor a Spanish Tapas place is.  Take my advice...don't be adventurous and stick with the proven winner...Ba-Ba-Reeba!  Two stars for the friendly staff and clean dining room.

Ordered: White wine Sangria, Lamb with potatoes.  DRINKS: The Sangria was pretty good. I mean, it's hard to mess up Sangria.  ATMOSPHERE: Date-y. Good for dates, you can definitely hear each other talk. It's dimly lit and has rustic Spanish decor. People were wearing jeans with blouses, dresses, heels, flats. Etc. A good variety of attire, but all in all everyone looked nice-- no one was in shorts and flip flops.  FOOD: Very Reasonably priced for the portions, and the lamb was spectacular. Awesome flavor and very tender. The bed of potatoes was also very much appreciated.  OVERALL: Would recommend, would return
Simple yet outstanding dishes are what separates cafe Iberico from other great tapas places. I'm always content after going here--if anything, they over serve you.

Service is great but food quality was relatively poor and the atmosphere was just not good. I could immediately smell something funky when walking into the place. Like an old basement. The restaurant needs a physical upgrade. When you walk in, it seems like a deli with a restaurant in the back which isn't bad except its divided by an ugly outdated bar so when you walk in you cant tell that you're actually in a restaurant. Its also in a pretty bad area as far as proximity to other places and transit - it feels a little off the grid in a bad way. Not a sketch area but not trendy or worth the trip. Food had decent flavor and quality but it was very greasy and both my boyfriend and I got sick. Portion sizes are decent for the price though. We just ordered tapas - sliced meat and cheese plate, salad, shrimp, empenada. The shrimp had good flavor but several were not de veined which is a big boo boo... i order shrimp at restaurants bc i don't want to do it myself... adequate preparation is what i expect. Bottom line.  So with that, i have no idea how this place has such raving reviews. It has potential but key issues should be addressed.

Came here on a Saturday night with a group of 3. Like everyone says, it's extremely loud so great for a fun night out with friends. Both the food and ambiance certainly more on the casual side compared to other authentic tapas restaurants.  Highlights: - gambas al ajillo (garlic shrimp) was flavorful  - datiles de jamon, because who doesn't like things wrapped in bacon?  - sangria pitchers  We also ordered the patatas bravas, grilled mushrooms, chicken brochette, and ham croquettes, which were all very average and often accompanied by tons of gloopy sauce.  Service was a bit lacking. The overall experience was good, but rating 2 stars because the oil that they serve with the bread IS NOT OLIVE OIL. It resembled some sort of cooking oil and tasted similarly - honestly just really grossed me out.

Such a unique restaurant with all kinds of dishes that I wouldn't dream of being combined together yet they all somehow work in perfect harmony and are soooo tasty. Nice dim lighting and always packed, great date spot.

Poor service!  We have been here for twenty minutes and still waiting on someone to give us a glass of water forget order. Seems like they don't have enough folks to help with service or don't want to service -  had a server walk past us twice before he asked if anyone has served us yet....

A great find! Upon entry, it's one side of the U-shaped bar and another few bar tables. The restaurant is quite large and there's a display case of smaller tapas.  If interest in small plates ... Ask for that menu.  I sat in the bar on opposite side next to dining /table service. The menu is 3 pages and you have plenty of shareable options. I ordered the grilled octopus/fries and the dates with rice. The 2 hot tapas (medium/bigger) plates were plenty for 1 person dining or 2 persons sharing for appetizers.  I would have preferred to be offered the small tapas menu because I could've ordered more smaller tapas options. I I will come back to try the paella!

I cannot recommend Cafe Iberico enough!! They have a one of kind atmosphere! it is so lively and the staff seems to truly enjoy working there. My bachelorette party started here and they did not disappoint! I was so pleased with how everything was handled. The Sangria is amazing, especially the white. The food is great and service is A+.

I've been to Cafe Iberico multiple times and although it is not my favorite tapas restaurant, I never leave disappointed eating here.  The size of the place is massive, which makes it very conducive to large groups but lacks the cozy Spanish charm you might be searching for.  The food is usually ok, nothing incredible but not bad either.  Some of the dishes that I think they do well include: - pulpo a la gallega: octopus, potatos and paprika, the octopus is always tender and delicious - bacon wrapped dates: although the dates are small, they are delicious and served with a creamy, tasty sauce Also, anything on their specials menu is usually delicious.  This last time, I tried their goat cheese wrapped eggplant, which was great.  For dessert, I like the banana with dulce de leche just because I love sugar and they serve a plate drenched in dulce de leche-it's great.  Don't forget to order a pitcher of sangria also, it's a good deal. Overall, it's a great choice for large groups and reasonably priced Spanish food in Chicago.
Its more about the ambiance than the food. Bring your crew of 12 and shout your brains off. Order 7 pitchers of red sangria and keep the vibe alive.

Nothing over the top for me. We ate in the dinning room, it was big and open and had nice seating. I guess if you eat in the dinning room the small plates are not offered?More like family style? We had a couple of potato dishes patatas ali oli (cold potato salad), patatas brava (spicy, warm potatoes) the spicy were good....ok house salad and goat cheese crustini. Tenderloin on a stick with fries and caramelized onions was average...kinda small for the price, the best value was a huge plate of fried calamari, done to perfection, light crispy and airy.  Now on to the "real tapas" as we were entering and leaving the restaurant there is a long counter with all these small plates I guess thats where you order the small plates. Which was what I thought we were getting into. LOL! For the price of the meal we had...we could order everything on the left and right side of the small plate menu and tried everything! The service was good.  The atmosphere is nice ...Next time real tapas!
Salmon a la pimienta was very delicious, not sure what sauce they use for the salmon but everything taste great and definitely recommend la sangria!!!

Best spanish Food in Chicago, they Also have the best sangria in town. Perfect for a first date, family, friends dinner .  I love getting the "pincho de pollo" and "patatas bravas".  And they play really good background music. Most likely pop en español.

Quality has declined. After several years away went and ordered a couple of items from their specials menu. Very disappointed. The soup was a black bean with pasta. That's it. Overly simple and weak. The cold pork tapa was basically 10 slices of cold cut pork with 2 olives, 2 pickles and some roasted pepper with left over angel hair pasta in the middle. I could have gone to subways and ordered a 12" sub with more meat in it for half the price. The patatas ali oli in all honesty seemed pre-packaged fare, not freshly made.  The mushrooms were very good and the calamari was good. But overall, the food wasn't what it used to be. Service was exceptional as usual. Our waitress was very friendly and ensured to come by often to see if we needed anything.

My daughter and wife have been telling me about this place ever since their last Chicago visit where they had a fantastic meal and evening here.  So I've been wanting to come here for a while. We finally visited on a short family vacation  to Chicago on a Saturday night. So here is a summary.  Pros:  - We were seated promptly (in about 15 mins) after we arrived at the restaurant (they don't take reservations for a party less than 8 on the weekends).  - The hostess and the server were very polite.  - some of the tapas were excellent. I liked the eggplant with goat cheese, the lamb, and the octopus. My daughter really liked the bread with goat cheese but I thought the bread was too greasy.  Cons:  - the sangria was not great. My wife remembered it to be much better on the earlier visit so it might just be an anomaly.  - some of the tapas were just okay. For example, I was quite disappointed by the chorizo.  - my main complaint however was with the noise. It was LOUD. And I mean REALLY LOUD! It was nearly impossible to hear the waiter and we felt that we had to shout to hear each other on the table. This is because of poor acoustics in the restaurant. This took away immensely from the experience and frankly we were exhausted by the end of the evening.  I would give it 4 stars for the food, five stars for the service (the servers were super nice although they were overwhelmed by the number of people), and zero for the ambience only because if the noise!

Topline: good, but not great.   As I am a fan of tapas, menus with a plentiful selection, and parties, of course, I was thrilled to revisit Iberico for a friend's bday party of about 14 diners.  We shared amongst us sangria, goat cheese, chorizo, patatas ali oli (cold potato salad), patatas brava (spicy, warm potatoes), hot chicken entrée, calamari, empanadas, shrimp, croquetas.  Yes, as you can tell, we had a hearty sampling of a lot of the highlights off the menu. Flavors were good, but I wasn't blown away.  Water service was surprisingly efficient for our large party. Iberico is great for groups; that's for sure!

Didn't like this place as much as I wanted too. Food portions were small, and service was slow. Came with my husband and his friend. We asked to sit by the window, but was told we'd have to be a party of six or more to be able to sit there. Noticed there was a party of 3 sitting there and that really annoyed me. Will not be returning.

The food was amazing and the service was great as well. We lived so close to this restaurant for a couple years and finally got the chance to check it out last weekend. My husband and I loved it. We will be coming back as regulars.

How does this place have such rave reviews? Their gluten free menu is a joke with 6 items or so on it. Even with these items, you have to make adjustments e.g. take the gravy off or patatas off. Anyhow, I went there with a friend and we decided to order a mushroom tapas and a shrimp in garlic & wine tapas. The dishes came out in 5 mins tops and were completely cold.  The dishes tasted so bad like somebody made them night before. I am never going back here again. We didn't finish our dishes, just paid the check and went to another place.

The red sangria is the best I've had. I love the mussels, clams in white wine sauce, spicy potatoes, scallops, and calamari grilled. Everything is served tapas style so it's great for sharing! The paella is another point to try but it does take some time to prepare so order first! Overall wonderful experience for family, friends or even a date! Salad!
Awesome food and awesome service.  The best tapas on the Chicago land area. A little too crowded but is totally understandable.   Thank you

I love this tapas restaurant! It's super affordable and delicious.  The food is very authentic and service is very attentive.  I have been to other tapas restaurants but I find them to be more expensive and the food is not as good.  The location is really central and easy to get to.  Some of my favorite dishes are Grecian octopus and seafood paella.  This place also accommodates large groups for baby shower and rehearsal dinner.  The wine selection is pretty good,  mostly Spanish wine and the server did a good job explaining.  The sangria is always a favorite too! I love how the food so delicious and you will leave the place full and happy without breaking your wallet.

I came with a person of Spanish descent and was told this is a super authentic restaurant.  We probably ordered almost every tapas item on the menu and they were all great! Funny enough, I thought many of the other dishes were better than the paella.  The paella dish could have included larger amounts of seafood, I've had massive dishes of paella in Barcelona before. Many of the pictures posted are spot on of what to expect.  There are many small bite sized items on plates for sharing.  The meal was filling without being heavy and feeling bloated. Service was pretty decent.  Drinks were very good also.

This restaurant is terrible. They allow women to dress like skanks, but refuse service to men who show their arms, even if it is in a classy way. They enforce policies that are not reflected in writing in their store or on their website. This is a sexist establishment that does not deserve business. What a joke.

I wish I could give this place no stars. I am so disappointed! I just came here with my two best friends and we were unable to eat because my male friend was wearing a cut off shirt, showing his arms/shoulders. The manager stated that this was the restaurant policy, and the host started taking out a tshirt, that they expected for him to put over his own shirt. He told her that the policy is sexist and she didn't really seem too concerned, and stated that "I'm sorry but that's the policy". We walked out very upset and starving! We had to walk 16 minutes to another tapas place (Emilio's Tapas Sol Y Nieve) where they welcomed us with no issues and even apologized for how we were treated by this place. Never coming here again. Which is sad because the food is amazing but I refuse to pay to terrible, sexist service!!

Sorry but I didn't like cafe' Iberico that much. Honestly I keep comparing it to Cafe' ba-ba-riba and I think that the second does Spanish food so much better for comparable prices.  We had the octopus. I would say ok but I would not definitely go back there for octopus. It was with fries. super greasy... and it's hard to make octopus greasy.  We had a pork skewer, again, dry and greasy... I liked the mushrooms, they were nice and fresh but overall it is a no. I am giving 3 stars bc the restaurant is not pricey but you get what you pay for and it is not much...

no longer a favorite..  food is just ok and service is terrible.  arrived to a fairly empty restaurant around 6pm and was told there was a 5-10 minute wait. was guided to the bar to wait while staring at empty tables. maybe the restaurant wants to encourage more drinks at the bar but that's a bit of a turn off and a waste of time. our food kept going to the table next door and our server was often nowhere to be found.. passed our table several times, acknowledged he saw us but then turned away. and don't get me started on the Arroz con Leche.. it was not good and I used to love it .  a shame what's happened as this was my go to tapas place and still a favorite for sangria but will not be going back.

This bustling tapas restaurant serves classic Spanish tapas in a rather brightly lit and loud dining room. Ironically enough, the bar is much quieter and more pleasant. In addition to the extensive list of rather large tapas items on the menu, there are smaller tasting size plates displayed in the cases that line the top of the bar. There's also a fairly extensive list of wines and fino by the glass or bottle. Service is efficient but busy.

We came on a Wednesday night around 6:30 and I'm glad we didn't come later since it became packed after 7. We ordered the seared scallops for an appetizer. The scallops were well cooked and seasoned. The creamy sauce that came with the rice portion of the plate was tasty. We both had the paella for our entrees, which comes in a large skillet. The portion size is very generous and a great deal for $15. It can feed about 1.5 people on average so definitely shareable between 2 people if other dishes are ordered. I ate my whole portion and was stuffed while my fiancé only ate about half of her plate. The paella itself is well seasoned with generous portions of meat. The seafood one comes with scallops, shrimp, mussels, clams and fish. All in all, it was a really good meal and worth a try for none on the fence.

I lived in Spain and have very high expectations of tapas. I think it's safe to say that for Spanish food in the United States, it was pretty good. It was not 100% authentic, but still tasty. I'd like to return soon!
We are from Spain and we can say that we ate at Cafe Iberico the best octopus in US! The service was perfect! The only thing that you should take in account is that this is noisy place.

Went there on a Sunday evening around 9:30pm. Ambiance: They were televising Copa America so the place was quite packed. The restaurant is quite large and I love how they use wine bottles as decor. Service: Our waiter was MIA a lot but it seems like he was the only waiter on the floor so perhaps the restaurant should reconsider staffing. It took forever for us to get our bill. Food: We had the clams which was good and their traditional paella which was okay. I've have had much better paellas so I wasn't impressed. I also had their white sangria which was yummy but too much ice. If I return to Chicago I would try another dish before making final verdict.

So many tapas to choose from that having four plates for two people was a disappointment. Disappointment because we were so full that it was unfortunate we couldn't have more. But I know we will be back to try to some of their other tapas.  This place is huge. And it can get pretty loud with big groups but that just makes the experience so much better. The spicy potatoes are a must.

My boyfriend and I came for dinner on a Sunday evening. When we arrived the television sets were tuned to a soccer game and VERY LOUD! When did this place turn into a sports bar?? I asked the manager to please turn the volume down but was informed that they were not loud. They offered to put us in a different room but that room was very warm, stuffy and loud with people talking. The management needs to add some sound proofing as the noise level is not suitable for dining.  The manager was very rude. We will not be returning.

While in Chicago on vacation, we had a late lunch here with extended family.  We tried about 12 different dishes.  I liked a lot of it.  Definitely a wide range of options and a full bar if you are interested in that.  The place is quite large with several dining rooms and a bar but we were there late and the place was pretty empty.   We tried: Ensalada de Vegetales - A selection of seasoned grilled vegetables marinated with sherry vinaigrette Croquetas de Pollo - Chicken and ham puffs served with ali-oli sauce Ternera Asada - Roasted veal served cold with raspberry vinaigrette Paella Iberica - A Cafe Iberico original, served with seafood, chicken and pork Several meat dishes with French fries We also have a few other dishes that I can't remember.  Everything was tasty and came at a good pace so we ate for a long time. Definitely an interesting place and something different.

Food: Delicious. Well worth the visit. My boyfriend and I stopped in on a Monday night and got five tapas dishes to share. It wasn't too much, but it also wasn't too little.  Waiters: The waiters were friendly, but they also were incredibly busy and sometimes forgot about us. My measure of good service is how long it takes to get more water once my glass is empty, and it took quite a while for them to refill. As I mentioned, they were nice when they came by, but it took a minute for them to get there.  Atmosphere: The restaurant is very nicely decorated, and the furniture is all well kept. They had TVs around the room playing the soccer game, which was nice. My only complaint is that it was so loud in the restaurant that I was barely able to talk to my boyfriend without shouting.  Overall: Great place, and I would go again!

I have been to Cafe Iberico many many times over the past 20 years. The space has changed a lot over time, but I feel like the food has not. Although their signature dishes are good, I just wish that they would introduce some new and elevated dishes. The food scene in Chicago has really exploded over the past years, so what I used to think was so great and unique at Cafe Iberico now seems more like middle of the road. I still think the place is a good bargain, fun, and good for groups and out of town visitors, but if you're a foodie looking for delicious exciting dishes, you might want to try elsewhere.

I went here after work with the wife and some colleagues.  While we enjoyed it, the food was not awesome.  The mushrooms were delicious.  The potatoes were standard - the Same thing you get at any tapas restaurant.  We also had small clams, which were steamed or boiled, a large empanada, and shrimp.  As happens with tapas, the food is expensive based on portion size.  We ordered at least two pitchers of red sangria with the food and I recommend that you try it. My only comment on the sangria was that the fruit wasn't all that good. Sometimes the fruit is good enough to sample, but not so much here.  The service was good.  The atmosphere is nice although it does get loud.
